grisu.jcommons.interfaces
Interface InformationManager

public interface InformationManager

An information manager provides Grisu with information about the grid and it's resources. This will normally happen via mds. But I could imagine writing an InformationManager that reads it's data from config files or such.

Author:
markus

Map<String,GridResource> getAllGridResources()
Calculates all GridResources grid-wide and returns a map of (unique) submission location and the associated GridResource.

Returns:
the map

getAllHosts

Map<String,String> getAllHosts()
Returns a map of all hostnames gridwide and the sites they belong to as value. Main purpose of this method is to increase the site lookup speed for hosts on the Grid

The returned map will have this format: ngdata.hpsc.csiro.au -> CSIRO-ASC ngdata.ivec.org -> iVEC

Returns:
all hostnames/sites

getAllSites

String[] getAllSites()
Return all the names of all the sites from MDS.

Returns:
names of all the sites from MDS

getAllSubmissionLocations

String[] getAllSubmissionLocations()
Returns all submission locations on all the sites from MDS.

Returns:
all the available submissionlocations on the Grid

getAllSubmissionLocations

String[] getAllSubmissionLocations(String application,
                                   String version)
Returns all the submission locations of all the sites that have the given application installed on their resources.

Parameters:
application - name of the software package
version - version number of the software package
Returns:
submission locations of sites which have the software application installed

getAllSubmissionLocationsForApplication

String[] getAllSubmissionLocationsForApplication(String application)
Returns all the submissionlocations for the given application. The entry for the submissionlocations are in this format: :[#] example: hydra@hydra:ng2.sapac.edu.au#PBS sque:ng2.vpac.org If jobmanager is not specified, it is assumed that the submission queue is of type 'PBS'

Parameters:
application - name of the application
Returns:
all the submission queues for the given application.

getAllSubmissionLocationsForSite

String[] getAllSubmissionLocationsForSite(String site)
Returns a list of all submissionlocations for the specified site.

Parameters:
site - the name of the site
Returns:
the submissionLocations

getAllSubmissionLocationsForVO

String[] getAllSubmissionLocationsForVO(String fqan)
Returns all submission locations or a specific VO.

Parameters:
fqan - the vo
Returns:
the submission locations

getAllVersionsOfApplicationOnGrid

String[] getAllVersionsOfApplicationOnGrid(String application)
Returns the list of available versions of the software application on the Grid.

Parameters:
application - name of the software package
Returns:
a string array of versions of the software application on the Grid

getAllVersionsOfApplicationOnGridForVO

String[] getAllVersionsOfApplicationOnGridForVO(String application,
                                                String vo)
Calculates all version of an application for a certain VO.

Parameters:
application - the application
vo - the vo
Returns:
all versions

getApplicationDetails

Map<String,String> getApplicationDetails(String application,
                                         String version,
                                         String submissionLocation)
Returns a map of the attribute details of the given application at the site. This method will give the client the values of the following attributes: - Module - SerialAvail - ParallelAvail - Executables (comma separated list) *

Parameters:
application - name of the software package
version - version of the software package
submissionLocation - the submissionlocation
Returns:
a map of the attribute details of the given application at the site.

getApplicationsThatProvideExecutable

String[] getApplicationsThatProvideExecutable(String executable)
Returns an array of Strings with codes that provide the specified executable.

Parameters:
executable - the executable
Returns:
the codes

getDataLocationsForVO

Map<String,String[]> getDataLocationsForVO(String fqan)
Returns all the data locations (mount points) on the grid available for the given VO. The key is the protocol & hostname, the values are paths.

Parameters:
fqan - fully qualified attribute name of the VO
Returns:
all the data locations for the VO

getGridResource

GridResource getGridResource(String submissionLocation)
Returns the GridResource object for the submissionLocation string. The GridResource object only has dummy values for dynamic stuff like freejobslots (for now).

Parameters:
submissionLocation - the submission location string
Returns:
the grid resource

getJobmanagerOfQueueAtSite

String getJobmanagerOfQueueAtSite(String site,
                                  String queue)
Returns the jobmanager that submits to the specified queue/site.

Parameters:
site - the site
queue - the queue
Returns:
the jobmanager

Parameters:
host_or_url - the host or the service's URI
Returns:
the name of the site where this host or URL belongs

                                        String site)
Returns the list of available versions of the software application at a given site.

Parameters:

Returns:

getVersionsOfApplicationOnSubmissionLocation

String[] getVersionsOfApplicationOnSubmissionLocation(String application,
                                                      String submissionLocation)
Returns the list of available versions of the software application at a given submissionlocation.

Parameters:
application - name of the software application
submissionLocation - name of the submissionlocation
Returns:
an array of string representing the available versions of the software application at the submissionlocation

isVolatileDataLocation

boolean isVolatileDataLocation(String host,
                               String path,
                               String fqan)
Returns whether the specified datalocation is volatile (which basically means that it is a filesystem that is used for running jobs) or whether it is one that is used to store static data (like finished jobs) by the user.

Parameters:
host - the host url as returned by the key part of getDataLocationsForVO(String)
path - the path as returned by the value part of getDataLocationsForVO(String)
fqan - the fqan (in order to identify above datalocation uniquely)
Returns:
whether the datalocation is volatile
